name: comFramework
short_description:
This project presents a flexible, widely customizable CAN
communication interface for embedded applications. It binds signal based
application code to the frame based hardware layer. The interface
implementation is code generator supported; particularly the unpack/pack
functions for message (de)composition are generated.

The high degree of flexibility results from using the template engine
StringTemplate V4 by Terence Parr, see http://www.stringtemplate.org/. The
engine is fed with the information parsed from the CAN network database
files (DBC files). It is capable to render this deeply nested data
structure and it can therefore transform the parsed information in nearly
any kind of textual representation.

The framework is completed by a generic CAN API, whose data dependent
parts are generated from the DBC file by the code generator. The
interface imposes only easy to fulfill requirements on the integration
environment and will fit in most embedded environments.
summary: Framework for CAN communication interfaces including code generator
